channel.title: MoparClassic Update
channel.description:
To whoever is interested,
I would like to "update" Moparclassic to become the next EasyRSC. It is one of the initial goals of the project to create a platform for the future. The updated version will be strictly Java8+ which means we will not be using scala or another language for scripting.
[b]Server UI[/b] Unlike EasyRSC, we will not be using a UI when starting a server but maybe we can use one to allow people to choose their content? The ScriptManager I wrote is a UI which allows for scripts to be activated/deactivated.
[b]Server Core[/b] The server core will be Elysium : https://github.com/Lothy/Elysium
[b]Server Scripting[/b] The server content will be completely scripted and each script will be its own Jar File. Scripts will be downloaded by future hosters either from the MoparScape website or our own website, maybe even github? Each piece of content will have its own file, for example Flax, Bowstring etcetcetcetc. It might seem excessive but is appropriate as we have seen plenty of different kinds of servers.
[b]Server Client[/b] TBD
Possible additions that need to be discussed: RSCDEF area unpacker/packer. If an area was not being used, the data for that area would not be loaded until it was activated and then removed out of the memory after a set amount of time without players. P2P places that lack player traffic would benefit from this.
Anti-Botting technology? It would come down to server owners using their own clients. I think we should just focus on offering a core technology.
Database. Should we allow users to choose their DB implementation or should we have a set standard?

item.title: MoparClassic Update
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Lothy:

I don’t even care anymore to be honest. I lost interest ages ago.

Sounds good.

Read full topic

I don’t even care anymore to be honest. I lost interest ages ago.

item.title: MoparClassic Update
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

How would you like to handle the handlers in relation to a plugin/script system?

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic Update
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Don’t use that, there are some cache consistency issues caused by the concurrency that I never got around to resolving.
Try https://github.com/Lothy/elysium-single-threaded instead.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparClassic Update
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

To whoever is interested,

I would like to “update” Moparclassic to become the next EasyRSC. It is one of the initial goals of the project to create a platform for the future. The updated version will be strictly Java8+ which means we will not be using scala or another language for scripting.

Unlike EasyRSC, we will not be using a UI when starting a server but maybe we can use one to allow people to choose their content? The ScriptManager I wrote is a UI which allows for scripts to be activated/deactivated.

Server Core
The server core will be Elysium : https://github.com/Lothy/Elysium

Scripts will be downloaded by future hosters either from the MoparScape website or our own website, maybe even github? Each piece of content will have its own file, for example Flax, Bowstring etcetcetcetc. It might seem excessive but is appropriate as we have seen plenty of different kinds of servers.

Possible additions that need to be discussed:

Anti-Botting technology? It would come down to server owners using their own clients. I think we should just focus on offering a core technology.
